title: I Hope Aliens Are Sparkly
text:
Photo: Masato Onoda/WWD/Shutterstock

Forget about your resting beach face. At Gypsy Sport’s out-of-office themed show, it was all about a beach body, with a glitter that would break the Kira Kira app. Several lucky models looked like beautiful aliens and were covered in ombre glitter from their head to their chunky Teva-ed toes. As Emilia Petrarca, our Fashion Writer said, “Euphoria is shaking.”

Model and drag queen West Dakota opened the show with a sunset-inspired gradiant sparkle made of several tones of warm twilight. Sure to please the ecoconscious (and Sparkle Pony Burners), the glitter from company Bioglitz is biodegradable and even comes with a special algae-based glue for application. It only took about an hour and a half to brush on the glitter (which was set with hairspray). “I found that it cleaned off easier than regular glitter. Regular glitter is plastic and has a lot of static which causes it to stick. It washed off pretty easily, with just soap and water. I have a little on me, but not as much. It’s mostly in my bathtub,” Dakota said. Shine responsibly.

Ebonee Davis Photo: Masato Onoda/WWD/Shutterstock

West Dakota Photo: JASON SZENES/EPA-EFE/Shutterstock
description: A review of the Spring 2020 Gypsy Sport runway beauty and makeup look, which was head-to-toe glitter courtesy of biodegradable glitter company Bioglitz.
